intro: Oreocharis nanchuanica, commonly known as the Nanchuan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender stems and lanceolate leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
